direction.raw_text: I googled you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's what us modern girls do when we have a crush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did it bother you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that depends. Is the bag empty because you hate people or just the baggage they bring along?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't hate people. I'm not exactly a hermit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just don't want to be tied down? The whole responsibility thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think it's even that... I... First time I ever flew, I was sixteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not going to answer? You're just going to tell me a story?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles, continues story) It was January and I had just gotten my driver's license. The lakes were frozen over, so we piled into my car and hit the ice to do donuts. When, out of nowhere, I hit a soft spot and the hood of my car tilted up and I was sinking backwards into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I literally started to drown. Within a few seconds, I black out. Then, I wake up in the sky. I'm in a helicopter, laying on a stretcher. This guy in a uniform is telling me I was minutes away from dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right? (relives it for a second) So just as we're hovering over the hospital, I sit up. And from there, I could see the whole western horizon. We'd been flying twenty minutes. Twenty minutes to reach a city I'd thought of as remote, halfway across the state... a foreign capital. (A BEAT) My parents had taught me we lived in the best place on Earth, but now I could see the world was really just one place and comparing didn't make much sense. And I remember thinking - Don't tell me this isn't an age of miracles. Don't tell me we can't be everywhere at once. The idea settles in. Ryan returns to the point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what originally sparked the back pack. I probably needed to be alone. Recently, I've been thinking that maybe I needed to empty the bag before I knew what to put back in. And now they kiss. It's notably different from their previous kisses. Now, when they lock lips, we are reminded why people kiss in the first place. Then, all of a sudden, the lights go out on the boat. The motor has stopped. Ryan and Alex look back to find the software dude stepping out of the galley, drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey... I think we're out of gas. Ryan and Alex look out to shore... about 500 yards away. For whatever reason, they just start cracking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan and Alex are huddled under a blanket in the corner of the rubber boat as it putters its way to shore. Cold, soaked, and smiling. Natalie and David are there too... still kissing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone gets out of the boat in the cold knee deep water and splashes up to shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan and Alex followed by Natalie and her make-out buddy, soaked from the knee down, holding their shoes, scamper into the hotel on the balls of their feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan's eyes flutter awake to see Alex getting dressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you're up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got to fly stand-by and make a meeting in Milwaukee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (notices, teasing) Oh, no. I made you feel cheap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, all right... Just leave the money on the dresser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll text you later so we can swap schedules. Alex gives him a peck. Ryan takes her wrist so she can't leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't remember the last time I enjoyed spending time with someone as much as you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neither can I. They kiss again and he lets go. Alex leaves and the door closes. Ryan just lays in bed for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan and Natalie have a quiet breakfast. Natalie looks pretty worse for wear. In the background is a TRAVELING SALESMAN rolling calls. He perks up for each message then goes back to being miserable. Meanwhile, after a little silent eating...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last night got a little out of hand. I said things... I don't remember everything I said. I just didn't want you to think...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just relax. It was nice to see you cut loose. So, did you wake him up or slip out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This morning... Your new friend. Did you wake him for an awkward good bye or just slip out so he could feel like a whore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I... just left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Protocol is always tricky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know what was right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes there really is no right thing to do. This doesn't comfort her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The walkway overlooks a large MARINA filled with giant
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ryan and Natalie are doing the photo thing with the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the engagement portrait again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to Alex?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Had to skip town early to make a meeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's too bad. Where does she live?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chicago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You thinking of going to see her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. We just don't have that kind of relationship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of relationship do you have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's, you know. Casual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds pretty special.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It works for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think there's any future there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never thought about it. What's going on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really never thought about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a good lie) No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you not think about these things? How does it not even cross your mind that you might want to have a future with somebody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's simple, you know that moment when you look into someone's eyes and you feel them looking right into your soul, and the whole world goes quiet for a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (finally, a break through) Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Well, I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're an asshole. Natalie knocks over the CUT OUT and stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh come on, I'm just dicking around. I need your help...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you think it's worth giving her a chance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A chance to what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A chance at something real?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie, your definition of "real" is going to evolve as you get older...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you stop condescending for one second? Or is that one of the principles of your bullshit philosophy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit philosophy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The isolation? The traveling? Is that supposed to be charming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's simply a life choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a cocoon of self-banishment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Big words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screw you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, screw you too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've set up a way of life that basically makes it impossible for you to make any human connections. Now, somehow, this woman runs the gauntlet of your ridiculous "life choice" and comes out the other end with a smile - Just so you can call her casual. Jesus. I need to grow up? You're a twelve year old. Natalie begins walking away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have a gauntlet of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: suddenly blows the CUTOUT across the boardwalk into the OCEAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Fuck! Ryan goes running after the cutout. He climbs down a GANGWAY to a dock that is closest to the CUTOUT, which is beginning to sink in the filthy water. Ryan reaches... and reaches... and just as he's got a finger tip on the photo... FALLS IN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan, still damp from the ocean, is drying the CUTOUT with a hair dryer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're following the CUTOUT HEADS popping out of the ROLL-AWAY like earlier, only now they are slightly faded and bent from their trip in the harbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're watching Ryan through the window of the plane. He almost looks trapped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The plane lands amidst snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan and Natalie drive in silence. The weather is frigid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These Detroit guys can be tough. They've been getting hammered. Don't get distracted. Stick to the simple stuff. Get the packet in their hands and get them out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A one story brick building. There's an inch of snow on the ground. Ryan and Natalie enter the building in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan and Natalie check in at the front desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door opens. Ryan and Natalie enter, when they both see something and immediately stop short. Sitting on the conference table is a COMPUTER set up for a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Framed up in a WINDOW on the screen is CRAIG GREGORY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome to Detroit. Natalie and Ryan exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been getting those great numbers over the last few days. Thought we should nut up and give this a try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could use a little more time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta leave the nest at some point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a real company, Craig. We're here to do some damage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Good thing we brought our best. So let's stop screwing around, alright? Ryan sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just give me a minute to prepare and get my things together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinking Natalie takes this one. Natalie, once confident, now takes pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's hardly ready for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been watching her. She's great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (re: the webcam) This is a whole other animal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, she created it. Natalie, you not up for it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm... I'm game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Atta girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan and Natalie have a moment aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just remember, don't apologize. Don't tell them how hard this is for you. Today is one of the worst days they will ever have. What we feel doesn't even compare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just keep it professional. You're going to do fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Craig is leaning back in his office chair, watching Natalie on his monitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An unsuspecting man in his mid fifties enters the room and takes a seat at a COMPUTER TERMINAL. (for the remainder of the scene, we will intercut between Natalie's room and the POV of the man's iChat session.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Mr. Samuels. My name is Natalie Keener.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (checking out the PC) What's going on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I was here with better news, however your position here at Deckers is no longer available.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've been let go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, just like that? I can't believe... Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Miss Keener. I am here to tell you about your options...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I work here for seventeen years and they send some fourth grader in here to can me? What the fuck is this?! Ryan fights the urge to jump in. He is sitting next to Natalie, but just out of view of the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's perfectly normal to be upset. However, the sooner you can tell yourself that there are greater opportunities waiting for you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greater opportunities? I'm fifty- seven-fucking years old! Mr. Samuels is now on the verge of tears. Eyes red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anybody who ever built an empire, or changed the world, sat where you are now. And it's because they sat there that they were able to do it. We remain in the room with Natalie and Ryan, but we hear Mr. Samuels crying. It's loud and embarrassing. It's coming from the next room. He's literally on the other side of the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a packet in front of you. Samuels picks up the packet and opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to take some time and review it. Samuels begins to leaf through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the answers you're looking for are inside those pages. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sooner you trust the process, the sooner your next step in life will unveil itself. Samuels puts down the packet. The tears still coming slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need you to return to your office now and begin to put together your personal things. Samuels doesn't move. He's just sitting there in a daze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for your time, Mr. Samuels. No reaction. Just more silent tears. Natalie is getting nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Samuels? There's nothing else we can discuss now. (AND AGAIN) Thank you for your time. Ryan fights the urge to break in as Natalie continues to lose her composure. Craig leans into his computer, watching intently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Samuels... Mr. Samuels.... MR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Finally, Samuels breaks from his daze. He looks up and around for a second, then gets up and leaves. Natalie catches her breath. A second later, Samuels passes their room, visible through the conference room windows. They watch as he walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did good. Natalie nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? Want me to take over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm alright. Natalie pulls out a LIST OF FORTY NAMES. The amount of people is daunting. She crosses off the first name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We find Natalie standing next to the rental car. She's staring into a snow drift. Her eyes say everything - She just grew up. Meanwhile, Ryan is on his CELL. We catch the end of his conversation with Craig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... We just got out here. That was one place. I think we need to try a few more... (LISTENS) Maybe there isn't a difference, but it's comforting to know we're in the next room. (LISTENING) I know you don't give a shit about my comfort. (LISTENS) We could just use a little more time. That's all I'm saying. (LISTENS) Right... Right. (shakes his head) Yeah... Alright... Uh huh. Bye. Ryan hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He thought you did a great job. You did - I was real proud of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.

direction.raw_text: We're being pulled off the road. (CLARIFYING) We're going home.

direction.raw_text: For good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what it looks like. A moment of mixed emotions.

direction.raw_text: Ryan, where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grabbing another flight... Something I need to take care of. I'll see you in, uh... at home. Ryan disappears in the crowd.

direction.raw_text: We're looking at the LUXOR PYRAMID.

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) Okay, start walking it in from the left.

direction.raw_text: I have to admit, when you asked me to meet you in Vegas... I thought we'd gamble, make out in a heart shaped jacuzzi, maybe see one of those weird French Canadian circus shows.

direction.raw_text: How do you feel about the wedding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think so?

direction.raw_text: How do you like Wisconsin in February?

direction.raw_text: Well... Yeah.

direction.raw_text: To a wedding... Jesus, Ryan. Your sister's wedding?

direction.raw_text: Look. You know. I'm not the wedding type. But for the first time in my life... I don't want to be that guy, alone with his drink. I want a dancing partner. I want a plus one. And if you can stomach it, I'd like it to be you.

direction.raw_text: Okay.

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I can't believe I... Yeah, I'm in. When is it?

direction.raw_text: Two ROLL-AWAYS side-by-side, moving through the terminal. Ryan and Alex walk in unison. They share a smile. Almost like they can't believe they're getting away with something. They pass a LARGE AIRLINE ADVERTISEMENT featuring MAYNARD FINCH in uniform. "We Value Your Loyalty."

direction.raw_text: Ryan's rental car pulls into the CHALET SUITES driveway. It's halfway between a Swiss Lodge and a Best Western. Just a little sadder. A yellow sign reads "Welcome Miller-Bingham Wedding Guests!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan and Alex approach the check-in lines. Of course, there's an elite membership line, but they can't use it. Ryan is forced to stand in a queue of three people while a

direction.raw_text: Ryan and Alex walk down the long hallway. They've been given a room at the end. Just as they're entering their room, the door across the hall opens revealing a woman in her early forties with a basket of laundry. It's Ryan's sister KARA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan? Ryan turns and stops. It's been a while...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kara... They hug. It's a strange hug. Awkward but heartfelt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex, this is my sister Kara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.

direction.raw_text: (quite frankly...) Ryan has told me nothing about you.

direction.raw_text: Kara, what are you doing at a hotel?

direction.raw_text: Fuck, I was hoping I wouldn't have to... Yeah, uh, Frank and I are trying out a trial separation.

direction.raw_text: You're not staying at the house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was an extra room on hold here, so I just took it for the weekend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, okay.

direction.raw_text: Yup. So, you guys are dating? Ryan and Alex fumble over each other.

direction.raw_text: Um...

direction.raw_text: It's not exactly...

direction.raw_text: Hey, don't worry about it. We're all getting a little old to be calling someone girlfriend... I remember when mom used to call Jack her boyfriend. It drove me up the wall. Boyfriends are for kids... (MOCK ANNOUNCING) And I'm just a divorcee! An awkward beat in the corridor of the Chalet Suites.

direction.raw_text: So, the rehearsal dinner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'll see you two there. Kara humps the laundry basket down the hall.

direction.raw_text: Ryan and Alex settle in. There's a cheap basket with a pink ribbon tied sloppily around some cellophane. In the basket is a packet, outlining the wedding weekend.

direction.raw_text: There's a packet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What in life is worth doing that doesn't have a packet.

direction.raw_text: Um, I love you? Ryan is kidding, but not really. They play it off as a joke, but can't help feel the weight of this "moment".

direction.raw_text: A group of tables have been slid together for the rehearsal dinner. Ryan and Alex find the dinner in full swing. Ryan's sister JULIE, the bride, waves wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God, Ryan! She hops up and gives him a hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be Alex. You are so beautiful. Kara was right. Did you get the basket?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The basket was very lovely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tammy wrapped all of them. Tammy waves.

direction.raw_text: Ryan, you look so grown up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me? You're the one getting married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, right? You haven't even seen my ring. Julie shows off her ring. It's not quite balanced and seems to favor quantity over quality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jim designed it.
direction.name: direction

location: CLUB ROOM FIRESIDE LOUNGE, CHALET SUITES
result.heading: INT.

direction.raw_text: raises a hand. This is Julie's husband-to-be and we can tell immediately that Ryan isn't thrilled. Ryan thinks of something. He pulls out the 5X7 PHOTOS they took of the JIM & JULIE CUT OUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought those photos you were asking for...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh great! They go over there. Julie points to a table and Ryan walks over. When he gets there, we see almost a hundred photos pinned to a map of America. It's overwhelming. All of a sudden, his effort seems miniscule. Ryan begins to pin his photos on the map over the cities where they were taken. He backs away to see it as a whole and his addition has already become invisible. Ryan returns to the conversation with his sister and Alex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There were quite a few already up there. Almost couldn't find room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, isn't it great how everyone chipped in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What gave you the idea to do something so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Substantial?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Jim has a lot of our nest egg invested in this real estate venture right now. So when we went over our finances, a honeymoon just didn't seem affordable this second... So I thought... Hey, just because we can't travel doesn't mean we can't have pictures. The idea of this lands on Ryan pretty hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a great idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan is stuck with Jim, talking real estate. Alex is having a chat with the brides maids about local relationship drama.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's sixty acres up against the foothills. I subdivided the old Lazy W Ranch and took a nice slice for myself.

direction.raw_text: No, I fire dozens of people a day.

direction.raw_text: She killed herself. Jumped off a bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. (FORMALITY) Do you remember anyone giving you any signals of anything? Depression?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're all depressed. We're firing them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, look, you know I have to ask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't remember anything. Of course they're upset. You never think that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wasn't any woman who gave you any indication...? Anything? Ryan remembers her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, nothing that stands out. (A THOUGHT) Is Natalie alright? Is she coming in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie quit. Ryan isn't surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Text message.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ryan stifles a laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, real fucking nice, right? No one has manners anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She say where she was going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah. She was pretty upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should give her a call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need you back in the air. Ryan doesn't react.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear me? I thought you'd be thrilled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. What about video conferencing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is pausing on the whole new media front for a moment. Giving it a little more thought. Getting our work horses back out doing what they do best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long are you sending me out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to let you sail and sail. Send us a postcard if you ever get there. Ryan absorbs this. Nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits at his desk. Bay Area sports paraphernalia on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, what happened? We turn to reveal Natalie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How exactly do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You graduated top of your class. You seemed to have your pick of employment... Including right here. Instead, you went to Omaha... to fire people for a living.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's challenging work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't imagine doing that day-in- day-out. Not in this climate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a beat) ... I followed a boy. The manager smiles to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody does at one point or another. The manager raises a letter - It's Ryan's letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This guy says I'd be lucky to have you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan writing the letter. We hear what he's writing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) To whom it may concern, I can't even count the number of people I've fired in my lifetime. So many, that I've forgotten what it's like to actually hire somebody. We've never met, but I know you'd be lucky to have Natalie Keener. My advice? Take her and don't look back. She'll be the best decision you've made in a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The manager puts down the letter and reaches out a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hope he's right. Natalie breaks into a smile, then jumps back to professional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan steps out his front door, ROLL-AWAY in tow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan walks through the automated door. He looks like he did in the opening of the film. Maybe even wearing the same clothes. Something is different though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Tonight, most people will be welcomed home by jumping dogs and squealing kids. Their spouses will ask about their day and tonight they'll sleep. Ryan stops and looks up at a GIANT BOARD OF DESTINATIONS. An endless list of cities around the world. A menu of new lives departing every five minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The stars will wheel forth from their daytime hiding places. We look back at Ryan. His eyes lock on one of the cities. We don't see which one. He makes a mental decision and turns in the direction of the gate. He lets go of his ROLL-AWAY.
direction.name: direction
